tool.name: coprarna
tool.description: Phylogenetic target prediction for prokaryotic trans-acting small RNAs

param.name: srnaseq
param.label: FASTA file with small RNA sequences

param.name: region
param.label: Region to scan in whole genome target prediction.
param.help: '5utr' for start codon, '3utr' for stop codon, 'cds' for entire transcript

param.label: Nucleotides upstream
param.help: Number of nucleotides upstream of '--region' to parse for targeting (def:200)

param.label: Nucleotides downstream
param.help: Number of nucleotides downstream of '--region' to parse for targeting (def:100)

param.label: Fraction of putative target homologs
param.help: Minimum amount (%) of putative target homologs that need to be available for a target cluster to be considered in the CopraRNA1 part (see --cop1) of the prediction (def:0.5)

param.label: CPU cores
param.help: Number of cores to use for parallel computation (def:1)

param.label: Maximum basepair distance
param.help: IntaRNA target (--tAccL) maximum base pair distance parameter (def:100)

param.name: cons
param.label: Controls consensus prediction
param.help: '0' for off, '1' for organism of interest based consensus, '2' for overall consensus based prediction

param.label: Top predictions
param.help: Specifies the number of top predictions to return and use for the extended regions plots (def:200)

param.label: No focus on the organism of interest
param.help: If set then the CopraRNA2 prediction mode is set not to focus on the organism of interest (def:off)

param.label: DAVID-WS functional enrichment
param.help: If set DAVID-WS functional enrichment is calculated with given number of top predictions (def:off)

param.label: Root function
param.help: Specifies root function to apply to the weights (def:1)

tool.help:
**What it does**
Phylogenetic target prediction for prokaryotic trans-acting small RNAs
CopraRNA is a tool for sRNA target prediction. It computes whole genome target predictions by combination of distinct whole genome IntaRNA predictions. As input CopraRNA requires at least 3 homologous sRNA sequences from 3 distinct organisms in FASTA format. Furthermore, each organisms' genome has to be part of the NCBI Reference Sequence (RefSeq) database (i.e. it should have exactly this NZ_* or this NC_XXXXXX format where * stands for any character and X stands for a digit between 0 and 9). Depending on sequence length (target and sRNA), amount of input organisms and genome sizes, CopraRNA can take up to 24h or longer to compute. In most cases it is significantly faster.
**Output** List of conserved identified interactions
